questions.question: In spite of his hard work, he could not score good marks.
questions.description: A simple sentence has just one finite verb and one clause in it.

questions.question: As soon as we heard the gunshots, we rushed indoors.
questions.description: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: When I opened the door, the cat jumped out.
questions.description: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: His remarks angered me but I said nothing.
questions.description: A compound sentence has two or more coordinate clauses connected by coordinating conjunctions.

questions.question: Though it was a holiday, I went to work as usual.
questions.description: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: If it rains, I will open the umbrella.
questions.description: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: She passed the test because of her hard work.
questions.description: A simple sentence has just one finite verb and one clause in it.

questions.question: He failed despite his hard work.
questions.description: A simple sentence has just one finite verb and one clause in it.

questions.question: It has been several months since we last met.
questions.description: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: We are in trouble because of your stupidity.
questions.description: A simple sentence has just one finite verb and one clause in it.

questions.question: She opened the book and started reading.
questions.description: A compound sentence has two or more coordinate clauses connected by coordinating conjunctions.

questions.question: I turned around but I didnâ€™t see anyone.
questions.description: A compound sentence has two or more coordinate clauses connected by coordinating conjunctions.
